csci331.team.red.server

Class ServerEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • csci331.team.red.server.ServerEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ServerEngine
extends java.lang.Thread
    Main game logic class. Manages flow of information between the two clients, and manages loading random game assets, as well as keeping client's in sync. Implements Thread and is runnable via Thread.start()


    CSCI331T OJ Pattern Controller

    This is the first non-UI thread that instantiates, maintains, and controls most, if not all non-UI elements of the game. The CharacterRepository and the various handlers:
    AlertHandler
    DatabaseHandler
    DialogueHandler
    DocumentHandler


    CSCI331T OJ Interface

    This class is my main interface with the game. There are various callback methods, usually of the form: onAction(). These methods are called primarily from NetServer
    I am also responsible for most of the Handler code, and that code is used inside the server package



    CSCI331T OJ Encapsulation

    This class provides many callback methods which provide encapsulation of core game logic to others.
    For example, the onPlayerConnect(Connection) method allows the NetServer to notify the server of an additional connection, without having to know how many players have, or should connect, and how to handle player connections.


    Author:
    ojourmel

    • Constructor Detail

      • ServerEngine

        public ServerEngine()
        Create a new ServerEngine object. Use Thread.start() to start the game engine in a new thread.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Main entry point to game logic. Called via Thread.start()


        CSCI331T OJ Overriding

        This method overrides the Thread.run() method It is the main entry point of any instance of a ServerEngine object after calling Thread.start()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • onPlayerConnect

        public void onPlayerConnect(com.esotericsoftware.kryonet.Connection connection)
        Callback for when a player requests connection to the server There are a max of MAX_PLAYERS players allowed This method also binds a Connection to a Role via NetServer.setRole(Connection, Role)
        Parameters:
        connection -

      • onPlayerDisconnect

        public void onPlayerDisconnect(Role role)
        Callback for when a player has disconnected. Disconnect the other clients, and stop this ServerEngine
        Parameters:
        role - Role

      • onPlayerQuit

        public void onPlayerQuit(Role role)
        Callback for when a player has quit. Shut down the other clients, and stop this ServerEngine

      • onPlayerPause

        public void onPlayerPause(Role role)
        Callback when a player pauses their game.
        Requests all other connected players pause their games

      • onPlayerResume

        public void onPlayerResume(Role role)
        Callback when a player resumes their game. Requests all other connected players to resume their game
        Parameters:
        role -

      • onIncidentComplete

        public void onIncidentComplete(Decision decition)
        Callback when an incident is completed. Signals the main thread to continue game play.

      • kill

        public void kill()
        Direct method to kill the server from the client, without going through the network. Useful in cases where no network connection could be established
